parameters: I heard the passage to the temple got blocked recently.
I'm sure there's still a way to get there though. Would have caused quite an upstir in the village if there wasn't.
A note is attached to the chest:
"To Open When The Time Is Right"
So you've come all the way from Kiliga have you? Must be some important information you're seeking.
Um, Mr Shiki, I've heard that you're over 130 years old, is that true?\n<\c[22]\n[2]>
Firstly, just call me Shiki. No Misters and no Sirs.
Secondly, I don't know who's spreading these baseless rumours about me.
(Of course, he couldn't be over 130, what was I thinking?)\n<\c[22]\n[2]>
After all, I'm only 125! They're trying to make me seem so much older than I actually am!
And you expect us to believe that?\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
Believe what you want kiddo, maybe one day I'll share my secret to such a long life with you guys, if we end up being good friends and all.
But come now, I know you didn't scale Mt Coronet just to know my age.
Well so,\! I wanted to know about\^\n<\c[22]\n[2]>
What was that monster back there!\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
Ooh, interrupting this fair lady over here, where's your manners?
I'm sorry but I need to know!\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
What about this monster has intrigued you so much?
I... I felt like I've fought this thing before!\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
It wasn't exactly the same, but vastly similar.\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
You say you've fought a similar beast, but...
Just like this one, my attacks went right through it.\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
I was fighting it in Azrath's castle, and
it attacked me and, and I suddenly found
myself in a distant forest, in a world
where no one understands what I'm saying!\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
Well if you keep spouting nonsense like Citrine and Valora then no one's going to believe you...\n<\c[22]\n[2]>
But how come you've never heard of these things?\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
Could you kindly tell me what year this is?
Why are you guys looking at me like that?\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
I'll save you the trouble of looking at the calendar.
Why do you seem so surprised?\n<\c[22]\n[2]>
My question is, dear, why are you not surprised?
The man's manner of speech clearly indicates he speaks with confidence.
Yes, somehow, \n[1] here has been transported back 832 years.
So does that make him OLDER than you, Shiki?
Hush now \n[3]! When the year 1632 rolls around, you can bet I'll still be walking as youthful as ever!
But, but, how did this, what, why?\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
Now that I know what has happened, let me get back to your original question.
The monster I fought back there was a Sinspawn, but I'm willing to bet the monster you fought was the actual Sin itself.
Sin is the embodiment of human malevolence. It is pure negative energy that feeds off the wickedness of our kind.
It feasts heavily on negative emotions and actions, and strikes on every turn of the century in an effort to erase humanity for their wrongdoings.
It is believed that Sin is our PUNISHMENT for our DARING negligence towards the DIVINE path of the Gods.
So this Sin thing is what brought me here.\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
Wait that means my people are in danger! Who knows what’s happening to them since I’m not there!\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
Steady now, even if you did miraculously make it back, what could you do? You know you can’t even hit it.
But I can’t just sit here and do nothing!\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
Sin is an embodiment of pure negative energy. No mere human could hope to lay a finger on it.
But, we saw you defeat that thing! How did you manage to land hits on it?\n<\c[22]\n[2]>
That is a SPECIAL secret Lord Shiki has told NO ONE.
Oh so now you’re calling me Lord? What’s next, God Shiki?
Well if you could touch Sin, does that make you a God?\n<\c[22]\n[2]>
No! I’m just as human as everyone else in this village!
And it's rude to intrude upon one's personal life.
So I would like it if you didn't ask me about it.
But wait, if you can touch negative energy, why can’t you defeat Sin?\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
What I fought back there was a mere Sinspawn. They happen to randomly spurt out of Sins body every now and then.
Imagine them to be “Baby Sins”. I could fight dozens of those as morning exercise.
But the actual Sin? Well my body is far too old for that!
Oh come on now, use your head silly!
Sin has appeared every 100 years to end humanity, and yet here we are, sipping coffee peacefully.
Everytime Sin has appeared, humanity has raised a hero to counter it. And our boy Leo here is proof that it’s still going strong till 1632.
Wait, you said you came from the year 1632 right?
Yeah, I don’t think sending people back in time is a very unstrange thing to happen.\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
No No No! It’s the year that Sin attacked!
Sin attacks on every turn of the century, yet you were attacked in the year 1632, not 1600.
Well when you put it that way, it does seem odd...\n<\c[22]\n[2]>
Hey I’ll let you know in my time, Sin didn’t just appear out of nowhere! This necromancer named Azrath summoned him and\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
I wouldn’t say summoned... more like awakened maybe?\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
Also, you say Sin “attacked” you. In any normal circumstances, you would have been eradicated instantly. Instead, you were sent back in time.
Let’s stop thinking about what’s going to happen 800 years in the future and instead think of what’s going to happen now! \n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
Ah yes, you have a point. So you want to know how humanity has combatted a foe that they can’t even touch.
But of course, they did so by being able to touch negative energy.
Stop it with riddles and go straight to the point. \n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
The answer to your questions, lies in the Temple of Seishin.
You mean the GRACEFUL God of Spiritual Awakening?
(Does he need to accentuate everything he says?)\n<\c[22]\n[2]>
Yes, the only God to have the power to ascend the average human to a spiritual being, capable of physically interacting with energy.
Humans that have been blessed by Seishin have the ability to combat Sin, though to harness the skills needed to do so is up to the individuals themselves.
So we just have to pray at this temple and receive Seishin blessings!\n<\c[22]\n[2]>
If it were only that easy.
The location of the temple has been lost to humanity over the past 150 years, and even if you were to find it, you would need to prove your worth at the 4 Temples of Divinity if you wish to enter.
The DIVINE Temple of Gaea is one of them right?
Indeed, I believe starting there is your best course of action.
So, lets not waste anymore time then!
Remember, Sin is the reason you got here, so Sin is your best chance of going back.

I shall accompany you. You have shown GREAT support to me in that fight. Even if it didn’t help much, I am WHOLEHEARTEDLY grateful for your eagerness to aid me. Allow me to repay this TREMENDOUS debt.
Cool now we have a tour guide!\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
I can be much more than just a tour guide...
I shall be, your MANLY PROTECTOR!
This guy is something else, that's for sure...)
Ok so, as I was trying to say in the beginning,\! I wanted to know if\^\n<\c[22]\n[2]>
Onwards to the Temple of Gaea!\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
(I’ll just ask when we get back)\n<\c[22]\n[2]>
So you've come all the way from Kiliga have you? Must be some important information you're seeking.
Um, Mr Shiki, I've heard that you're over 130 years old, is that true?\n<\c[22]\n[2]>
Firstly, just call me Shiki. No Misters and no Sirs.
Secondly, I don't know who's spreading these baseless rumours about me.
(Of course, he couldn't be over 130, what was I thinking?)\n<\c[22]\n[2]>
After all, I'm only 125! They're trying to make me seem so much older than I actually am!
And you expect us to believe that?\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>

I... I felt like I've fought this thing before!\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>

Indeed, I believe starting there is your best course of action.
So, lets not waste anymore time then!
Remember, Sin is the reason you got here, so Sin is your best chance of going back.
I shall accompany you. You have shown great support to me in that fight. Even if it didn’t help much, I am grateful for your eagerness to aid me. Allow me to repay the debt.
Cool now we have a tour guide!\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
I can be much more than just a tour guide...
Ok so, as I was trying to say in the beginning,\! I wanted to know if\^\n<\c[22]\n[2]>
Onwards to the Temple of Gaea!\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
(I’ll just ask when we get back)\n<\c[22]\n[2]>
By the way, be careful when treading into the temple. Sin's toxin has already began to spread through the world.
It’s the first warning to humanity that Sin is coming. All species afflicted by it begin to grow increasingly aggressive, especially towards humans.
Some may even experience physical changes, such as unnatural growth or strength.
I've even heard of inanimate objects coming to life because of it!
So that explains why all those animals suddenly began attacking us!\n<\c[22]\n[2]>
And also that freaking huge bird we found!\n<\c[10]\n[1]\c[0]>
I went to Mt coronet myself to check on the situation, and it already seems to be pretty tight.
Humans aren’t immune to the toxin either, although we require a much higher exposure to develop symptoms.
Considering the state of the mountain, I’m pretty sure the toxin has already spread to the temple itself.
